description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus a 12-month running mean of SST anomalies by a Newtonian cooling over the sub tropical North Atlantic (10N-35N).  The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.   SST  anomalies (1950-2014) will be provided by DCPP.
name: RestoreSSTrunningMeanSubTropNAtlantic
rationale: To investigate the role of sub tropical north Atlantic sea surface temperatures in the modulation of global surface temperature trends and in driving regional climate variations.
longName: Restore to 12-month running mean of SST in the sub tropical north Atlantic
keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, running mean, sub tropical north Atlantic
